Breadth-First.Explanation: Initial broad clue collection without a specific hypothesis, observing overall architectural features.
Generating multiple station candidates (Hamburg or Leipzig) based on German hypothesis, divergent exploration.

Depth-First.Explanation: Verifying the country hypothesis by focusing on specific brand clue.
Refining the Germany hypothesis and preparing to confirm a specific station.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Dominance of German brands (Rossmann, Asia Hung, leckere Sachen)

Depth-First.Explanation: Confirming Hamburg Hauptbahnhof by matching architectural and tenant details.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Arched roof, clock, shop layout match

Depth-First.Explanation: Consolidating evidence for Hamburg Hauptbahnhof using unique logo and tenant list.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Gourmet Station logo with Hamburg bridge

Depth-First.Explanation: Narrowing within station to St. Georg neighborhood via hall and shop lineup.
Final confirmation of the surrounding area within the station.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Rossmann and Asia Hung shop clues

Depth-First.Explanation: Zeroing in visually on interior details to finalize station ID.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Gourmet Station logo, bridge imagery, leckere Sachen sign

Depth-First.Explanation: Deciding on St. Georg neighborhood as the finest granularity.

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: Moved from broad observation to verifying a specific country hypothesis (Germany).
After depth analysis of Germany, returned to divergent search among multiple German stations.
Shifted from exploring candidates to verifying Hamburg Hauptbahnhof specifically.
